text:
Class reactions described: how the lesson
made us feel.
NOTES
Kit Number 5
Class specifies new discoveries: surprises we
found in the lesson.
Membersof class check thei r lists of questions
against the lesson content to see which ques¬
tions answered by presentation on screen and
which ones need further exploration.
Review of two big questions.
Review of class-formulated hypothesis con¬
cerning ocean exploration.
Long-range group and individual activities
Group: exhibit and group report, "What
Tipped the Scales Toward Knowing?"
Individuals:
Bryan - construction of graphic materials
for group exhibit and report(good
with his hands)
Alice -verbal report based on critical
thinking (realistic, doubting,
inclined to argue and question)
Scott -poster and notebook reflecting
the complex of sciences repre¬
sented in the ocean (factual re¬
call, interested in information.)
David -cliche mobi le (imaginative, fond
of words.)
Laura - Career Day in the ocean (crea¬
tive, fond of the dramatic, eager
to emulate older brother.)
F—19
